content:
As I stood on the bridge with Clarke, I couldn't help but take in my surroundings. The technology was advanced and unfamiliar to me, but I could see the purpose and function of it all. I saw a few people working on different stations, and I couldn't help but feel a sense of awe and wonder.

Clarke noticed that I was trying to put everything together and started comforting me. "Don't stress too much, Madi," she said, her voice filled with understanding. "You've been in cryo for so long, you'll need time to adjust."

I nodded, feeling a sense of relief wash over me. I knew that it would take time, but I was determined to help in any way that I could.

"What can I do to help on the bridge, Clarke?" I asked, my voice filled with eagerness.

Clarke smiled at me, her expression filled with pride. "You can help us navigate, Madi," she said, her voice filled with encouragement. "You can help us find a new home."

I nodded, feeling a sense of determination wash over me. I would help Clarke and the rest of our new family navigate and find a new home. I would be a part of that new home, and we would all be okay.

As Clarke showed me around and taught me how to navigate, I couldn't help but feel a sense of belonging. I was a part of something bigger than myself, and I knew that together, we could overcome any obstacle.

The end.
